title: High Gross Capital Formation
description: In 2022, Vanuatu's gross capital formation was 56.07% of GDP, indicating a strong investment in capital assets relative to its economy.

title: Significant Gross Fixed Capital Formation
description: Vanuatu achieved a gross fixed capital formation of 55.45% of GDP in 2022, showcasing robust investment in infrastructure and fixed assets.

title: Impressive Adjusted Net Savings
description: In 2020, Vanuatu's adjusted net savings, including particulate emission damage, stood at 37.98% of GNI, reflecting strong economic sustainability.

title: Low Taxes on Income, Profits, and Capital Gains
description: In 2021, taxes on income, profits, and capital gains accounted for only 0.23% of Vanuatu's revenue, indicating a low tax burden in these areas.

title: Minimal Net Bilateral Aid from the UK
description: In 2022, Vanuatu received minimal net bilateral aid flows from the UK, amounting to -$60,000, highlighting limited financial support from this donor.

title: Low Quality of Regulations for Dispute Resolution
description: In 2024, Vanuatu scored 47.30 in the quality of regulations for dispute resolution, indicating room for improvement in legal frameworks.

title: Inefficient International Trade Regulations
description: Vanuatu's quality of regulations for international trade was rated at 44.87 in 2024, suggesting challenges in trade facilitation.

title: Low Efficiency in Importing and Exporting Goods
description: In 2024, Vanuatu's efficiency in importing and exporting goods was rated at 13.20, indicating significant logistical challenges.

title: Limited Public Services by Tax Administration
description: In 2024, Vanuatu's public services provided by the tax administration scored 12.03, highlighting potential areas for service improvement.
